Seeing those who come to request, like the thought of a good teacher.

The cultivation of wholesome roots is limitless;
Using the adornments of the pure lands to perfect one's own buddha land;
Practicing limitless giving, fully endowed with the major and minor marks;
Eliminating all evil, purifying body, speech, and mind.
Therefore, sometimes one has little but a full heart, or one has a full heart but little wealth. Now that both are fully present, one is able to open the door and give greatly.

For countless eons in birth and death, the mind is courageous;
Hearing the Buddha's immeasurable virtues, the resolve is untiring;
Using the sword of wisdom, one destroys the thief of afflictions;
Emerging from the aggregates, realms, and sense bases, one takes on the responsibility for sentient beings, forever liberating them.
With great diligence, one subdues the army of demons, always seeking the wisdom of the true aspect of non-thought.
Not giving rise to the four-part biased thoughts of existence and non-existence is true wisdom.ğŸ”½Practicing few desires and contentment, yet not abandoning worldly dharmas;

Question:

Since the empty dharmas are also empty, therefore one is able to not realize emptiness.

I contemplate the TathÄgata, not coming from the past, not going to the future, and not abiding in the present. This fully explains how the essence of the Dharma transcends the hundred negations and embodies the myriad virtues.
This first sentence clarifies that it is not in the three times, wishing to discern that the dharmakÄya is not conditioned.

Not observing form, not observing the suchness of form, not observing the nature of form;

not observing feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, not observing the suchness of consciousness, not observing the nature of form and consciousness - the five aggregates are also conditioned, so next, in terms of the five aggregates, it clarifies that it is not the Dharma body.

first, not observing form, which is not the view of existence;

Since the Dharma body transcends the four propositions, it also does not observe neither existence nor non-existence.

Not arising from the four great elements, the same as empty space - the five aggregates are the effect, and the four great elements are the cause. Since the effect is not the Buddha, the cause is also so.
Not being a cause or an effect, it is therefore the same as empty space.

The six sense bases are not accumulated - since the Dharma body is neither cause nor effect, it also transcends the internal and external. Since it is neither external nor internal, it cannot be accumulated in the six sense bases to become Buddhahood.

The eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind have already passed - the previous passage clarifies that it is not the external sense bases, this passage distinguishes that it transcends the internal nature.

Not a single characteristic, not a different characteristic below, Sengzhao said, Since there is no non-characterized, it cannot be made one;
